ikigai_analysis_report.primary_ikigai: Local planning and environmental stewardship (Elmbridge Borough Council monitoring)
secondary_areas: Digital privacy and account security practice

supporting_evidence.pattern: Sustained, self-configured monitoring of local planning activity and environmental impact
examples: Elmbridge Borough Council referenced 5+6 times; KT12 4BX and environmental impact assessment appear repeatedly
Distill alerts set to track planning applications and details (e.g., irrigation reservoir EIA, boundary fence/realignment, landscaping, gatehouse)

supporting_evidence.pattern: Ongoing curiosity about decentralized tech and markets
examples: Consistent interests over time: Bitcoin (4), Blockchain consensus mechanisms (4)
Chosen topics include DeFi (3) and S&P 500 (3), indicating self-directed research outside marketing

supporting_evidence.pattern: Active care for privacy and account security
examples: Microsoft account (4) and security alert (4) appear as consistent interests
Privacy noted among chosen topics (3), suggesting a voluntary focus on digital hygiene

supporting_evidence.pattern: Growth and learning orientation embedded in daily habits
examples: Learning indicators present 6 times; terms like course (3), tutorial (1), develop (4), education/growth (3 total) show active skill-building
AI agents (3) suggests hands-on exploration of new tools

framework_dimensions.external_connection: Strong tie to the external world via local government processes—tracking Elmbridge Borough Council applications tied to real places (e.g., KT12 4BX) and environmental assessments connects personal choices to community outcomes.
framework_dimensions.active_engagement: Evidence of action over passive consumption: configuring Distill page monitors, repeatedly checking planning updates, and digging into technical topics (consensus mechanisms, AI agents) rather than only reading headlines.
framework_dimensions.emotional_meaning: Repeated attention to environmental impact and neighborhood planning implies care for place, landscape, and shared spaces—sources of quiet, everyday satisfaction.
framework_dimensions.voluntary_pursuit: Topics are self-chosen (alerts set up by the user; repeated crypto/privacy queries); not driven by required communications or commercial pushes.
framework_dimensions.everyday_joy: Small, regular check-ins on planning pages; following specific application changes; tinkering with agents/tech; maintaining account security—all modest, daily actions that add meaning.
framework_dimensions.growth_orientation: Clear learning signals (courses, tutorials, developing) across technical domains suggest enjoyment in incremental mastery and evolving interests.

personal_samples.Subject: New Research: TEE: Building Trust for the AI Era
personal_samples.Key_Topics: TEEs, AI, blockchain, confidential computing, secure enclaves
personal_samples.Summary: Research alert discussing how trusted execution environments (TEEs) and blockchain enable secure, confidential AI, with examples from iExec RLC, Phala Network, and Oasis.

recommendations: Keep a simple planning log: when an Elmbridge application changes, note what changed and why it matters to you; aim for 5-minute entries.
Translate one planning item into action each month (e.g., submit a public comment, attend or watch a council session, or visit the site).
Create a lightweight EIA checklist to quickly assess new proposals (flooding, biodiversity, traffic, noise) during your routine checks.
Run one hands-on crypto experiment per month (e.g., simulate a consensus mechanism, run a testnet node, or compare staking vs. PoW security) and journal key learnings.
Build or refine a small AI agent to summarize council updates or track specific planning keywords (e.g., “EIA,” “boundary,” your postcode).
Establish a monthly privacy cadence: security key/passkey check, password manager audit, and recovery-code review—treat it as a quick, satisfying ritual.
Protect joy by scoping: 15-minute daily planning review, one deeper dive per week, and one tangible contribution per month to avoid overwhelm.

methodology.approach: Content-based filtering to identify authentic personal communications

framework_principles.external_over_internal: Connection to external world through personal choice
framework_principles.everyday_joy: Small daily activities that bring meaning (seikatsu ikigai)
